detail_info.name_class: Citropin 1.1 (natural AMPs; UCLL1c; XXA, frog, amphibians, animals)
detail_info.source: skin secretion, Australian blue mountains tree frog,Litoria citropa
detail_info.activity: Anti-Gram+ & Gram-, Antifungal, Anti-MRSA, Anti-inflammatory, Antibiofilm, Anticancer
detail_info.additional_info: Activity: Active against L. lactis (MIC 3-6 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >100 ug/ml), P.multocida (MIC>100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 12-25 ug/ml), L. innocua (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. uberis (MIC 12 ug/ml), S. aureus or MRSA (MIC 25 ug/ml), B. cereus (MIC 25-50 ug/ml), L. innocua (MIC 100 ug/ml), and B. subtilis (MIC 12.5 ug/ml) (Calabrese AN et al., 2012).  Also, active against Gram+ E. faecalis PCM 2673 (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or 9144 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae ATCC 49619 (MIC 32 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or 23506 (MIC 32 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 16 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 128 ug/ml), fungi  A. niger ATCC 16404 (MIC 64 ug/ml), C.albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 128 ug/ml), and C.glabrata ATCC 15126 (MIC 128 ug/ml) (Neubauer et al., 2017).Structure:  The solution structure is an amphipathic alpha-helix with well-defined hydrophobic and hydrophilic regions.Updated 10/2012; 4/2019; validated 7/2021; 8/2024
